poem:
### Torrential Beginnings

Raindrops splatter  
on closed doors,  
calm faces beneath  
the shiver and drip.

Beside us, chaos—  
a birthday girl spins  
her own wild dance,  
tugs of rescue.

We breathe between  
life's spray,  
laugh at  
weather's whim—  
a date made  
in torrents.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Blind date: ‘A drunk birthday girl tried to join our date and had to be forcibly removed by her friends’ Alan on Robert What were you hoping for?To get out of the usual apps-based dating at the very least – and maybe even the start of something great. First impressions?Calm, friendly and handsome. When we got to the bar it had closed down and it was raining torrentially, which broke the ice. He suggested a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
